current.get_started_left_content:
The Assimil method is perfect for you if:

  • You’ve tried other methods like Rosetta Stone and weren’t impressed
  • You don’t want to sit in a classroom to learn a new language
  • You don’t want to spend more of your day in front of a computer
  • You’re about to take a trip to a foreign country
  • You have a hectic schedule and need flexibility
current.get_started_right_content:
Get started now & save — Only $74.99

Discover the joy of learning a foreign language with Assimil.

Get Started Now
current.get_started_right_content_middle: Discover the joy of learning a foreign language with Assimil.
current.reviews_title: What people are saying about Assimil
current.review_1_content:
The only Spanish word I knew before starting the Assimil Spanish course was “hola”. But now, after completing the program, I can speak Spanish! In fact, I can also read and write Spanish without much difficulty. Sometimes, when I’m watching Spanish TV, they speak so fast that some words pass me by but overall, I understand what everyone is saying - and now I’m hooked on Spanish soap operas!
I got to test out my Spanish skills on a short missionary trip to Tegucigalpa, Honduras and now I feel even more competent in my language abilities. I had no trouble expressing myself and was able to order in a restaurant with ease and sit down and talk to the locals. I even gave a talk in front of a hundred or so people at the church - in Spanish! Now I can see myself doing more traveling in Spanish speaking countries and listing my new skill on my resume!
I tried other language programs to learn Spanish and other languages, but I either didn’t stay on track because of the design of the program or because of it simply being outdated when it comes to proven language learning theories. But the Assimil Spanish course actually worked!
current.review_2_content:
My company has expanded its offices to China. As such, I have a higher opportunity for advancement if I learn Chinese. I was talking to my girlfriend about it and she had to learn a foreign language for work. She recommended that I try out the Assimil product. I've never heard of it before but now she wouldn't steer me wrong so decided to try it out.
The Chinese course I received comes with both a course books and CDs. I can listen to the CDs and follow along with the book at my own pace. I can do multiple lessons in one day, stick to one lesson, or repeat the same lesson on multiple days if need be. Assimil doesn't recommend a specific pace. They simply recommend that you go at the pace you feel most comfortable with. Some days I was able to do a couple lessons, other times I could only do one lesson every couple days. So far, It’s working pretty well. Absolutely recommend.
current.review_3_content:
I bought the Assimil French language course because my company was relocating its headquarters to Quebec and moving all its employees (including me) along with it. Now, I had never studied French at all, and this took me as a complete surprise. Needless to say I was just a bit panicked at the thought of having to learn a new language in just a few months’ time.
Well, lo and behold, I just finished the whole course last week and I'm feeling tres bien about my ability to speak French in any context. I can easily read, write, speak and understand French without too much difficulty. (Note: French movies, shows and news programs can be a little bit difficult to follow, but I can usually figure out what is going on and I can read cartoons pretty well.)
current.review_4_content:
Altogether I've taken four years of German in the classroom setting with a couple of years of studying on my own on top of that. Still, I simply could not master speaking German. It wasn't until I started using Assimil's German course that everything started to come together and make sense. Instead of speaking in phrases, I started speaking in complete sentences!
In the classroom there was very little opportunity to speak German. Same thing with the commercial programs that only teach you what to say as a tourist. But I wanted to learn to communicate in every day situations. Basically, I was seeking to become fluent in German instead of just learning phrases like, "Where is the restroom?" And "Can you please carry my bags?" Instead, I learned, "Excuse me, could you please help me?' As part of the Assimil German Language course. This phrase can be used anywhere for any reason you need help. See the difference?
And I really got to test out my knowledge when I spent two weeks in Germany. Because I learned some everyday expressions from the Assimil language course, I could navigate through the country with no problem, easing in and out of various situations. Sometimes, when I wasn't really thinking about it, my pronunciation was so spot on that even the locals were impressed. However, it took some time to be able to understand others since everyone talked so fast!
I was at lesson 20 when I went to Germany and now I am on lesson 50. There are 100 lessons in total in the German course and by the time I'm done, I expect to be fluent!
current.review_5_content:
My parents and I were taking a month-long trip to Israel. My mom grew up there, but she hadn't been back since she was a child.
My dad grew up in New York, but had always wanted to visit Israel. I gave them both tickets for Hannukah. I was looking forward to meeting relatives that I heard so many stories about but never met, and I know my mom and dad were really looking forward to seeing family they hadn't seen in decades. My dad didn't know any Hebrew.
My mom didn't speak it to us because she wanted to make sure we learned proper English and then got too busy to teach us after that.
So the only Hebrew I had been exposed to was what I memorized for my Bar Mitzvah. I really wanted to learn Hebrew well this time, so I could speak fluently to my relatives.
I needed a quick way to brush up on Hebrew, since it's been a while since my Bar Mitzvah, and I had already forgotten most of what I learned.
I had tried a few apps previously, and although they helped with reading and writing, I needed more help with conversation.
My aunt had recommended Assimil because my cousin used it to learn Hebrew, so I thought I would give it a try. It wasn't very expensive compared to some of the other language learning programs. My dad split the cost with me because we were both learning Hebrew at the same time. He had a lot of fun speaking to my mom, and it brought tears to my mom's eyes to hear her husband speaking the language of her family and childhood again.
So a little bit about the Hebrew course. There are around 100 lessons. The first half of the program is pure learning. You learn new vocabulary, grammar, culture, etc. After you get through the first half, you start doing a lot more reviewing and learning to say new things in different ways, so it really builds upon the first half of the course.
About a month before our trip, my dad and I really buckled down and did two lessons a day, one early in the morning, and one in the evening after work. Each lesson is about 30 minutes, so it wasn't hard to do two in a day.
Since I had studied a little bit of Hebrew with my Bar Mitzvah, I was able to do about 3-4 lessons on day. The lessons are relatively short and easy. By lesson 5, they definitely became a little more advanced, but not in a difficult way, just more in-depth.
So I ended up doing about two lessons per day on average. If I got really busy at work, or had a bad commute, or was just tired, I couldn't keep up. But that didn't happen too often, and I finished 26 lessons in two weeks.
I thought I might be able to keep up while I was visiting my family in Israel, but there has been so much catching up to do, it was hard to find a quiet moment to study. I visited a lot of the holy sites in Israel with my family, and my parents were so happy to be there catching up with family. I'm so glad I had the chance to experience this with them.
While I was there, I was able to understand a lot of what my aunts, uncles and cousins were saying. I had plenty of volunteer tour guides to help us get around, but I could still understand everything that was being said. It wasn't difficult ordering food at restaurants either.
Now that I'm back in the states again, I was very excited to start learning Hebrew again, and I can't wait to go back again. I love Israel, and I met so many great family members that I don't want to lose touch with. I started doing one lesson a day again, and my dad wanted to do the same. So you can guess what I'm buying him for Hannukah this year - his own set of Assimil Hebrew language course. It's now become a family project, learning the Hebrew language. My mom couldn't be happier.
current.review_6_content:
I picked up Assimil for Italian to prep for a trip to Italy. I focused on the audio portion of each lesson to practice listening to Italian. The lessons start off pretty short and easy, but as you advance in skill, they become longer and more in-depth. Assimil recommends that you spend about 30 minutes a day per lesson. This wasn't difficult, and some days I could do 3 lessons a day. I like to take notes for each lessons, because it really helps me learn.
The way the lesson is laid out is with Italian on the left and English on the right. On the bottom of the page are notes on grammar and culture. I have always enjoyed grammar as a language student. You learn the grammar as you go, so it integrates well with what you are learning. I also found the notes on culture very helpful for understanding the basis of the language, and also come in handy for my trip to Lebanon.
After each dialogue, you are introduced to new sentences and expressions made up of the words you just learned. This made me think a lot and reinforced my memorization and understanding of the words. I got pretty comfortable with making up sentences in Italian this way.
I didn't finish the whole course before I went off to Italy but I got through about 60% of the material. By the time I was done I could read, speak, and understand a lot of Italian. The second half of the lessons do a lot of reviewing of past lessons, and really take you to that next level of conversation and reading and writing.
current.review_7_content:
I won't lie. I was pretty intimidated at the idea of picking up Japanese. A friend suggested Assimil, so I figured I'd give it a shot.
For the most part, I followed the instructions Assimil gives to the learner: listen to the audio file with the book closed, then read the book without the audio playing, then do both at the same time. About half way through, Assimil switches from the “passive” phase to the “active” phase. This is where the lessons review previously learned materials and help you to put together words and phrases in new ways to say more things.

It may sound extremely simple, and maybe it is, but it has been extremely effective. I’m roughly 60% of the way through the course.
After each dialogue, a series of sentences and expressions will be presented to you that take the words you have just learned and rearranges them in different ways. This was especially helpful, because it made it easier for me to get the benefit of immersion in the language. You can learn how to say many common and specific Japanese phrases, even with just a few words. There are more exercises to help cement the things you have learned.
At this point, I am able to read, write, speak and understand a lot of conversational Japanese.
current.review_8_content:
If you are interested in south American culture, the stunning landscapes, and monuments there- then you would benefit from learning Brazilian Portuguese using the Assimil language learning system.
I started Assimil’s Brazilian Portuguese course with zero prior knowledge of Brazilian Portuguese. Now, I just completed the entire program only last week, and I feel really confident with what I’ve learned. I can now read, write, speak and understand Brazilian Portuguese with very little difficulty. Although, I’m not totally fluent in Brazilian Portuguese. Their movies and news programs are sometimes difficult to follow, but I can always understand the gist of what is being said, and I can follow and understand my favorite Brazilian shows pretty easily.
I spent some time in Florianopolis for educational purposes as well as for work and leisure (It’s a long story), and I believe the European language competence system is a fair assessment. After all, Europe is a collection of many countries in close proximity to each other, so I feel they should know what they’re talking about.
Whatever B2 fluency means, I feel pretty comfortable in most situations speaking casual Brazilian Portuguese.
I feel that I have accumulated a very effective Brazilian Portuguese vocabulary, and I can pretty much express anything I need to whether it’s asking for directions, ordering from a menu at a Brazilian restaurant, or just about anything else. Even though I came into my study of Brazilian Portuguese with absolutely no prior experience, besides having taken a few years of Brazilian Portuguese in high school, I no longer feel any huge language barrier when visiting there. I also tried to teach myself German in the past.
My experience with other language programs isn’t comprehensive, but in my opinion, Assimil just works beautifully.
Using Assimil has been like opening a door to Brazil and Brazilian culture for me. The program makes learning Brazilian Portuguese easy and exciting by giving you useful words and phrases that you don’t get in a formal setting or with other language learning programs.
If you are planning to spend any time in Brazil, I recommend it very highly!
current.review_9_content:
I decided to order Assimil Russian Language Course after finding out that I would need to present research findings for a study that I conducted at my university at a conference in Moscow. I was quite nervous about attending this conference because my Russian is not very good.
Although I have studied some Russian before, I did not have a solid grasp of the language.
Therefore, I decided to order the course about four months before my trip to brush up on my Russian language skills.
The course materials arrived quickly in the mail. They included a book and audio CDs that can also be used on the go.
The lessons were short and simple. They included a Russian dialogue and the translation. Grammar and pronunciation information were included with each lesson, as well. I found this especially useful as I struggle with Russian pronunciation.
I spent about one hour a day learning the materials. I also reviewed the audio CDs in the car every day just for extra practice.
When it was time for my trip, I felt confident and self-assured with my grasp of the language. I presented my research findings and interacted with peers easily using the skills that I have learned from this course.
current.review_10_content:
The only Spanish word I knew before starting the Assimil Spanish course was “hola”. But now, after completing the program, I can speak Spanish! In fact, I can also read and write Spanish without much difficulty. Sometimes, when I’m watching Spanish TV, they speak so fast that some words pass me by but overall, I understand what everyone is saying - and now I’m hooked on Spanish soap operas!
I got to test out my Spanish skills on a short missionary trip to Tegucigalpa, Honduras and now I feel even more competent in my language abilities. I had no trouble expressing myself and was able to order in a restaurant with ease and sit down and talk to the locals. I even gave a talk in front of a hundred or so people at the church - in Spanish! Now I can see myself doing more traveling in Spanish speaking countries and listing my new skill on my resume!
I tried other language programs to learn Spanish and other languages, but I either didn’t stay on track because of the design of the program or because of it simply being outdated when it comes to proven language learning theories. But the Assimil Spanish course actually worked!

current.learn_content:
Assimil is one of the best Russian language programs, complete with book, CD and MP3s, and each course is packed with 2,500 words and expressions. With Assimil, you'll be speaking Russian in no time, and once complete, you'll be able to speak Russian in a fluent and effective manner. In no time at all, you'll quickly and easily pick up:

  • Russian vocabulary
  • Russian grammar
  • Russian verbs
  • Russian conversation

Whether you are a beginner, just starting out or looking to take your Russian to the next level, Assimil is the most efficient program to learn Russian quickly.
